results.title: The Incas
results.brief_description: A historical, geographic and cultural view of Incan civilisation, shown by visits to authentic sites, archaelogical remains and existing Peruvian village life. The distinctive features of the Incan government and the economy based on agriculture and small industries and crafts. Includes re-enactment of the Incan worship of the pagan sun-god.

results.title: The Incas
results.creator_credit: Anna Benson Gyles and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chronicle”.
Little is known about the Inca empire, which stretched over 2,000 miles from Ecuador to Chile, during the 15th and 16th centuries. However archaeologists are busy digging behind the myths and legends surrounding the Incas and are learning more about how they ran their enormous empire so successfully. Narrated by Ian Holm.

results.title: The Inauguration of the Pleasure Dome
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Anger Magick Lantern Cycle”.
A convocation of magicians assume the identity of gods and goddesses in a Dionysian revel, Lord Shiva, the magician awakes. The Scarlet Woman, whore of heaven, smokes a big, fat joint; Astarte of the moon brings the wings of snow; Pan bestows the grapes of Bacchus; Hecate offers the sacred mushroom. The vintage of Hecate is poured. Pan’s cup is poisoned by Lord Shiva. The orgy ensues - a magic masquerade at which Pan is the prize, Lady Kali blesses the rites of the children of light as Lord Shiva invokes the godhead.

results.title: The In crowd
results.creator_credit: Mark Rosenthal, Lawrence Konner, Keith Rubinstein, Orion Pictures Corporation and Force Ten
results.brief_description: Its 1965, and rock’n’roll has ricocheted around the world. Nowhere is the music more popular than Philadelphia, where smooth-talking Perry Parker (Joe Pantoliano) hosts the city’s hottest TV show “Dance Party”. The dancing fever has also infected the suburbs where Del Green (Donovan Leitch), a high school senior, spends most of his time spinning, twisting and daydreaming of Vicky (Jennifer Runyon), “Dance Party’s” reigning teen goddess. On a dare Del foregoes his college entrance exam, auditions for the show, is chosen and becomes an instant success. Del and Vicky become “Dance Party’s” hottest new couple. To the beat of 60s rock’n’roll, and against a steamy backdrop of fancy footwork and raw competition, their make-believe romance becomes a doomed off-stage love affair.

results.title: The Impressionists
results.creator_credit: George Barford, Egons Tomsons and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: An explanation of the impressionist style and spirit is given. The film then follows chronologically, through the works of Monet, Manet, Pissarro, Sisley, Renoir and Degas, illustrating differences and similarities between them. Brushwork and style is examined.

results.title: The Impressionable years: American children and the public library
results.creator_credit: Peter Elgar and United States Information Service
results.brief_description: Describes a young girl’s first experience of the children’s room of the New York Public Library. Evokes in an imaginative way the pleasures, satisfactions and companionship children can find in reading. Shows story hours, simple reference work and borrowing routines. Emphasises the child’s freedom of choice and the way in which the library is scaled to their requirements. Narrated by Henry Fonda.

results.title: The Impossible takes a little longer
results.creator_credit: Anne Henderson, Barbara Janes, Kathleen Shannon and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The Impossible Takes a Little Longer documents the work and personal lives of five physically disabled women. It shows how they are coping with the problems they share with all women, the problems they share with other disabled women and those unique to their particular circumstances. The film affirms that disabled women can lead full and productive lives as workers, as mothers and as valued community members. It informs both disabled women and the able-bodied about the possibilities of adaptations in the workplace, the use of technological aids and the need for support systems if disabled women are to have satisfying and productive lives. The Impossible Takes a Little Longer undermines the stereotypes and prejudices that further hinder a large segment of our population.

results.title: The Impossible dream
results.creator_credit: Dagmar Doubkova, Peter Hollander and Kratky Film
results.brief_description: An animated film without narration about a family which operates within traditional stereotyped roles where the woman is mother, housekeeper and wage earner while the man is wage earner only. Shows how the children imitate their parents in these sex roles. A useful discussion starter in the area of sex role stereotyping. Suitable for middle and upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: The Impossible
results.creator_credit: Summit Entertainment, Apaches Entertainment, Canal+ España, Instituto de la Cinematografía y de las Artes Audiovisuales, Institut Valenciã de Cinematografia (IVAC), Mediaset España, La Trini, Generalitat Valenciana, Telecinco Cinema, Sparka Lee Hall, Álvaro Augustín, Belén Atienza, Ghislain Barrois, J. A. Bayona, Sergio G. Sánchez, Maria Reyes and Anna Bingemann
results.headline_credit: Spain and United States of America, 2012
results.brief_description: In December 2004, close-knit family Maria, Henry and their three sons begin their winter vacation in Thailand only for the devastating Indian Ocean tsunami to strike.

constellations_other.name: Representing disasters
constellations_other.description: The devastating Indian Ocean tsunami was captured by many people on personal devices and home cameras, with the footage broadcast to the world. The event also inspired feature films that are part of a long tradition of disaster films, which often push the boundaries of VFX.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Summit Entertainment, Apaches Entertainment, Canal+ España, Instituto de la Cinematografía y de las Artes Audiovisuales, Institut Valenciã de Cinematografia (IVAC), Mediaset España, La Trini, Generalitat Valenciana, Telecinco Cinema, Sparka Lee Hall, Álvaro Augustín, Belén Atienza, Ghislain Barrois, J. A. Bayona, Sergio G. Sánchez, Maria Reyes and Anna Bingemann
results.description: In December 2004, close-knit family Maria, Henry and their three sons begin their winter vacation in Thailand. But the day after Christmas, the idyllic holiday turns into an incomprehensible nightmare when a terrifying roar rises from the depths of the sea, followed by a wall of black water that devours everything in its path. Though Maria and her family face their darkest hour, unexpected displays of kindness and courage ameliorate their terror.
